metadata.title: Barcelona Food Tour
metadata.description: Learning Spanish to enjoy authentic cuisine in Barcelona!

curriculum.lesson_topic: Barcelona Food Tour: Learning Spanish to enjoy authentic cuisine in Barcelona!

sub_topics.description: Learn essential phrases and vocabulary to confidently order tapas and drinks at a local bar, understanding the menu and common expressions.
Practice asking vendors about produce, prices, and specialities while exploring La Boqueria Market, learning to bargain politely and understand local products.
Learn how to discuss typical Catalan dishes, express your preferences, and understand recommendations from locals regarding regional cuisine.
Master the phrases needed to make restaurant reservations, specify dietary needs, and handle any special requests politely in Spanish.
Acquire the vocabulary to describe the flavors, textures, and presentation of food, allowing you to give detailed feedback and express your culinary experiences vividly.

flashcards.definition: Tasting; often refers to a wine or food tasting event.
flashcards.example: La cata de vinos en el barrio gótico fue mi parte favorita del tour.

flashcards.definition: A sample or tasting, usually a small portion of food or drink.
flashcards.example: La degustación de tapas incluyó jamón ibérico y queso manchego.

flashcards.definition: Pairing; refers to the combination of food and drink that enhance each other.
flashcards.example: El experto nos explicó el maridaje perfecto entre el vino y el plato de pescado.

flashcards.definition: Cured meats; a variety of sausages and cured meats, common in Spanish cuisine.
flashcards.example: En la charcutería probamos una selección de embutidos artesanales.

flashcards.definition: Small savory dishes, typically served with drinks in Spain.
flashcards.example: Fuimos de tapas por el Born y probamos patatas bravas y croquetas.

flashcards.definition: Seasonal products; foods that are at their best during a particular time of year.
flashcards.example: El chef utiliza productos de temporada para garantizar la frescura de los platos.

flashcards.definition: Typical dishes; traditional foods that are characteristic of a region.
flashcards.example: Probamos varios platos típicos catalanes, como la escalivada.

flashcards.definition: A famous public market in Barcelona, known for its fresh produce and local products.
flashcards.example: Visitamos la Boquería para comprar ingredientes frescos para cocinar paella.

flashcards.definition: The time spent after a meal, often chatting and relaxing at the table.
flashcards.example: Después de la cena, disfrutamos de una larga sobremesa con café y licores.

flashcards.definition: Appellation of origin; a protected designation indicating a product's geographical origin and quality.
flashcards.example: El vino tiene denominación de origen Priorat, lo que garantiza su calidad.

exercises.sentence: En el mercado de La Boquería, probamos una deliciosa tapa de jamón ibérico, que se ___ en la boca con cada bocado.
exercises.explanation: 'Derretía' (melted) accurately describes the sensation of the jamón ibérico in your mouth. 'Quemaba' (burned), 'endulzaba' (sweetened), and 'enfriaba' (cooled) don't fit the sensory experience of tasting quality jamón.

exercises.sentence: Para la paella, es fundamental usar arroz bomba, que ___ muy bien los sabores del caldo de pescado y mariscos.
exercises.explanation: 'Absorbe' (absorbs) is the correct term, as bomba rice is known for absorbing flavors. 'Rechaza' (rejects), 'evapora' (evaporates), and 'cocina' (cooks) don't describe this specific property of the rice in paella.

exercises.sentence: Después de la cena, nos ofrecieron un chupito de licor de hierbas, que ___ el estómago y ayuda a la digestión.
exercises.explanation: 'Calma' (calms) is the appropriate verb, as herbal liqueur is meant to soothe the stomach. 'Quema' (burns), 'hincha' (swells), and 'corta' (cuts) don't fit the typical effect of a digestive liqueur.

exercises.sentence: Al pedir churros con chocolate, la camarera nos preguntó si los queríamos con azúcar ___ por encima.
exercises.explanation: 'Espolvoreada' (sprinkled) correctly describes how sugar is typically added to churros. 'Frita' (fried), 'derretida' (melted), and 'caliente' (hot) do not logically follow the context.

exercises.sentence: En la bodega, el sumiller nos explicó cómo ___ el vino para apreciar mejor sus aromas y sabores.
exercises.explanation: 'Catar' (to taste, to sample) is the right word for professionally evaluating wine. 'Beber' (to drink) is too general, 'producir' (to produce) refers to making wine, and 'vender' (to sell) involves commerce, not tasting.

simulation.title: A Culinary Adventure in Barcelona
simulation.setting: Two friends, Emily, an American tourist trying to improve her Spanish, and Javier, a local Barcelonian foodie, embark on a food tour through the vibrant streets of Barcelona. Emily wants to learn more about authentic Catalan cuisine, and Javier is excited to share his knowledge and help her practice her Spanish.

content.speaker: Javier
content.target_language_text: ¡Bienvenida a Barcelona, Emily! ¿Lista para probar la mejor comida catalana?
content.phonetics: bjem-beh-NEE-dah ah bar-theh-LOH-nah, EH-mee-lee. EH-stahs LEE-stah pah-rah proh-BAR la MEH-hor koh-MEE-dah kah-tah-LAH-nah?
content.base_language_translation: Welcome to Barcelona, Emily! Are you ready to try the best Catalan food?

content.speaker: Emily
content.target_language_text: ¡Sí, estoy muy emocionada! Quiero aprender sobre la comida y practicar mi español.
content.phonetics: see, eh-STOY muy eh-moh-thyo-NAH-dah. Kye-RO ah-prehn-DER soh-BREH lah koh-MEE-dah ee prah-tee-KAR mee ehs-pah-NYOL.
content.base_language_translation: Yes, I'm very excited! I want to learn about the food and practice my Spanish.

content.speaker: Javier
content.target_language_text: Perfecto. Primero, vamos a una panadería tradicional. Tienen un 'pa amb tomàquet' delicioso.
content.phonetics: pehr-FEK-toh. Pree-MEH-roh, VAH-mohs ah oo-nah pah-nah-deh-REE-ah trah-dee-thyo-NAHL. Tyeh-NEHN oon 'pah am too-MAH-ket' deh-lee-THYO-soh.
content.base_language_translation: Perfect. First, let's go to a traditional bakery. They have a delicious 'pa amb tomàquet'.

content.speaker: Emily
content.phonetics: pah am too-MAH-ket? keh ess EH-soh?

content.speaker: Javier
content.target_language_text: Es pan con tomate, ajo y aceite de oliva. ¡Muy sencillo, pero increíble!
content.phonetics: ess pahn kon toh-MAH-teh, AH-ho ee ah-THAY-teh deh oh-LEE-bah. muy sehn-THEE-yoh, peh-roh een-kreh-EE-bleh!
content.base_language_translation: It's bread with tomato, garlic, and olive oil. Very simple, but incredible!

content.speaker: Emily
content.phonetics: Sway-nah heh-nee-AHL! Des-pwehs, ah DOHN-deh VAH-mohs?
content.base_language_translation: Sounds great! Where are we going after that?

content.speaker: Javier
content.target_language_text: Luego, al mercado de La Boqueria. Allí probaremos jamón ibérico y queso manchego.
content.phonetics: LWEH-go, al mer-KAH-doh deh la Boh-keh-REE-ah. Ah-YEE proh-bah-REH-mohs hah-MOON ee-BEH-ree-koh ee KEH-soh mahn-CHEH-go.
content.base_language_translation: Then, to La Boqueria market. There we will try Iberian ham and Manchego cheese.

content.speaker: Emily
content.target_language_text: ¡Qué rico! Siempre he querido probar jamón ibérico auténtico.
content.phonetics: keh REE-koh! Syehm-PREH eh keh-REE-doh proh-BAR hah-MOON ee-BEH-ree-koh ow-TEHN-tee-koh.
content.base_language_translation: How delicious! I've always wanted to try authentic Iberian ham.

content.speaker: Javier
content.target_language_text: Y para terminar, cenaremos tapas en el barrio Gótico. ¡Prepárate para una explosión de sabores!
content.phonetics: ee PAH-rah ter-mee-NAR, theh-nah-REH-mohs TAH-pahs en el BAR-ryoh GO-tee-koh. Preh-PAH-rah-teh PAH-rah oo-nah ehks-ploh-SYON deh sah-BOH-rehs!
content.base_language_translation: And to finish, we'll have tapas for dinner in the Gothic Quarter. Get ready for an explosion of flavors!

content.speaker: Emily
content.target_language_text: ¡Estoy lista! Gracias, Javier. ¡Va a ser un día increíble!
content.phonetics: eh-STOY LEE-stah! GRAH-thyas, hah-VYER. Vah ah sehr oon DEE-ah een-kreh-EE-bleh!
content.base_language_translation: I'm ready! Thank you, Javier. It's going to be an incredible day!
